properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:17 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This storm is located 15 km west of Pigeon Lake and is heading to the east at 15 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-07-17T01:16:38-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 40 are expected for the next 4 days. A hot and humid tropical air mass will affect Toronto beginning Friday. The heat and humidity will last through the weekend to at least Monday. Afternoon temperatures will reach the low to mid thirties. Humidex values will reach 40 each afternoon as well. Temperatures overnight will remain in the low to mid twenties, providing little relief from the heat. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. Slightly cooler and less humid conditions may arrive on Tuesday. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-17T11:29:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T19:30:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0926400205.2020
Area: City of Toronto
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 38 are expected for the next 2 days. Temperatures are expected to reach near 30 degrees Friday and Saturday. Humidex values will likely reach the mid to upper thirties both afternoons. Temperatures overnight will remain in the upper teens to near twenty, providing little relief from the heat. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. Somewhat cooler and less humid air will arrive on Sunday. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-17T12:03:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T20:04:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3001491678.2020
Area: Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. Squalls are expected to move across the lake this evening and could possibly produce wind gusts of up to 40 knots and sudden torrential downpours. ### Poor to very poor visibility may contribute to voyage delays and make marine navigation hazardous. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-17T05:25:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T21:37:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3583521898.2020
Area: Eastern Lake Erie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms will develop along the foothills this afternoon and evening and will move eastward. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. Watches may be expanded this afternoon. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-17T07:59:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T17:05:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1172001522.2020

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: near +2 (coolest in low lying areas). Locations: central and western Newfoundland. Time span: early Friday morning. Remarks: Patchy frost is expected to form as clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures, especially in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-17T05:14:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T13:15:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3794183453.2020
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:00 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 45 kilometres southwest of Gull River Provincial Park to 15 kilometres west of Silver Falls Provincial Park to 9 kilometres southeast of Arrow Lake Provincial Park, moving east at 60 km/h. Hazards... Peak wind gusts to 100 km/h and nickel size hail. Source... Radar indicated. Severe thunderstorms will be near: Thunder Bay around 5:15 PM EDT. Cloud Bay around 5:20 PM EDT. Locations impacted include: Thunder Bay, Whitefish Lake, Kakabeka Falls Provincial Park, Kakabeka Falls, Silver Falls Provincial Park, Pigeon River Provincial Park, Cloud Bay, Moose Lake, Mackies, North Fowl Lake, Nolalu, Sunshine, Flint, Mokomon, Wamsley, Crystal Lake, Little Dog Lake, Oliver Lake, Kaministiquia and Pardee. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-16T23:25:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T21:01:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3688687802.2020

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots, frequent lightning, hail of 1 to 2 centimetres and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times are expected or occurring in the area. A line of thunderstorms will race east from Thunder Bay out over the Lake beginning near 5.30 PM. Squalls of 45 knots and heavy downpours suddenly reducing visibility to less than half a mile are likely. The thunderstorms will weaken by evening as they move further offshore over Lake Superior. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-16T23:59:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T21:12:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1096954836.2020
Area: Western Lake Superior
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:32 p.m. CDT (5:32 p.m. EST), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located near Pickle Lake, moving east at 20 km/h. Hazard: 100 km/h wind gusts and nickel size hail. Locations impacted include: Pickle Lake and Central Patricia. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-17T00:59:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T22:33:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0540809005.2020
Area: Pickle Lake - Cat Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: zero to +2 (coolest in low lying areas). Locations: most of Newfoundland. Time span: early Friday morning and early Saturday morning. Remarks: Patchy frost is expected to form as clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures, especially in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-17T10:23:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T18:24:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1790983972.2020
